meanings.definition: To establish or organize an institution again.
meanings.sent1: After the old building was renovated, they reinstitutionalized it as a school.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to reinstitutionalize the museum after years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: The town reinstitutionalized the community center, making it a hub of activity once more.
meanings.sent4: The company reinstitutionalized its training program, ensuring all employees received proper guidance.
meanings.sent5: The mayor's plan to reinstitutionalize the library brought joy to the residents.

meanings.definition: To place someone back into an institution.
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended that they reinstitutionalize the patient for further treatment.
meanings.sent2: The court order allowed them to reinstitutionalize the troubled individual for their safety.
meanings.sent3: The family had to make the difficult decision to reinstitutionalize their loved one for specialized care.
meanings.sent4: The social worker worked to reinstitutionalize the homeless person into a shelter.
meanings.sent5: The caregiver had to reinstitutionalize the elderly man due to his worsening condition.
